I think I know what's going on, SD deletes the mass definition and replaces it with geeASL that's what's causing the error

I'll have to fix GN for not accounting for that, I have no idea how much that will take me since I'm not in the country right now ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
Tried GN again and Kerbin is still 'cloaked'. However it did move the Origins planets to another star. Any ideas [@Sigma88](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/113260-sigma88/)

Ok, tell me what to send you other than screenshots. I just unzipped the installed from the KSP homepage, installed Kopernicus, Module Manager, and ModularFlightIntegrator via <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>, unzipped Galactic-Neighborhood.v0.3.1.zip to the temp install folder overwriting the Gamedata folder.

I start a new sandbox game and it is initially sunny, by goes dark. I can see Kerbin in the tracking center however. It's still perpetually night on the surface of Kerbin. The Sun never comes up at <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> at any time warp. I could send a clip....

I couldn't see anything wrong in the logs/installation screenshot so I decided to reproduce the install myself

everything looks fine on my laptop:

![Screenshot%202017-01-04%2009.34.41.png?d](https://www.dropbox.com/s/w0fy4b91xgnjeja/Screenshot%202017-01-04%2009.34.41.png?dl=1)![Screenshot%202017-01-04%2009.34.53.png?d](https://www.dropbox.com/s/i4yi0lxsokuk2ce/Screenshot%202017-01-04%2009.34.53.png?dl=1)

so there are two options:

1- You are referring to the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> screen, which is broken because of reparenting of Kerbin

it's just a graphical glitch and it doesn't affect the flying scene (as you can see from my screenshots)

this is a kopernicus bug which I would not expect to go away anytime soon, it comes from some assumptions KSP makes about kerbin orbiting the center of the universe

2- you are actually having a bug, but since I cannot reproduce it I have no idea how to help you

I tested this on my laptop while on the train, I can get a better look once I get home (gen-8th) but I don't expect to find much more than I already wrote here

sorry if this hasn't solved your issue

Wow, I didn't even try to launch something, my bad...... That's so weird. Go to the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>, get in a vessel, launch, and it's daytime??? Land, recover vessel, and it's night again???  LMAO  Ok, I will try out some planet packs and installing KSPI-E and see how it goes. I am truly ONLY trying to be helpful and contribute.
I'm using ksp 1.2.2. Is this mod going to work for me? Also the planet packs you have listed as supported are all supportive of earlier versions of ksp. Will they work for a 1.2.2 install?

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, Noel32 said:
> 
> 
> I'm using ksp 1.2.2. Is this mod going to work for me? Also the planet packs you have listed as supported are all supportive of earlier versions of ksp. Will they work for a 1.2.2 install?
> 

GN will work on 1.2.2 provided you install the correct version of Kopernicus

The planet packs might or might not work, that's for the developer of those mods to check. I just offer the integration into GN ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I realise I'm perhaps being a little hasty, not to mention proposing still more work, but would it be possible to integrate [the revived version of Interstellar Adventure](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/155620-12x-kopernicus-interstellar-adventure-revived-v100/), at some point?

Sounds entirely reasonable.  I guess I'll have to make do with the *plenty of other systems GN can provide*.  What a tragedy.

(with somewhat less self-directed sarcasm, thanks for GN.  It is a wonderful thing as it is.)

There seems to be a really bad easily reproducible bug with this and the newest kopernicus. With just this and kopernicus(No planet packs), all stars seem to overheat ships to anywhere between 7000 to 400000 in the matter of single frames upon tossing them on the launchpad. Reproduced this with two other people so far with the three states being the same: Stock(Obviously nothing overheating), Kopernicus(Still fine), GN(Instant overheats on the launchpad).

> 
>

Reproduced this with two other people so far with the three states being the same: Stock(Obviously nothing overheating), Kopernicus(Still fine), GN(Instant overheats on the launchpad).
> 

smh

not this again ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

I'll look into it ![7w472zO.png](http://i.imgur.com/7w472zO.png)

PS: I blame [@Thomas P.](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/113164-thomas-p/)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-02-08T15:10:06Z" title="02/08/2017 03:10  PM" data-short="7 yr">February 8, 2017</time> by Sigma88**
In the meantime, is there a value that affects how much heat a star puts out? One of us noticed the black hole didn't actually overheat stuff.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Crimor said:
> 
> 
> In the meantime, is there a value that affects how much heat a star puts out? One of us noticed the black hole didn't actually overheat stuff.
> 

yes, the [luminosity](https://github.com/Sigma88/Sigma-Dimensions/blob/master/%5BKittopiaExports%5D/Sun.cfg#L150)

set that to zero and it should avoid overheating, only downside is that it would also kill the solar panels.

you should write a patch that looks something like this:

    @Kopernicus:FINAL
    {@Body:HAS[@Template[Sun],~name[StockSun]]{	%ScaledVersion	{		%Light		{			%luminosity = 0		}	}}
    }

**Edited <time datetime="2017-02-08T15:09:52Z" title="02/08/2017 03:09  PM" data-short="7 yr">February 8, 2017</time> by Sigma88**

>

> In the meantime, is there a value that affects how much heat a star puts out? One of us noticed the black hole didn't actually overheat stuff.
> 

could you try with the newest version of Kopernicus? 1.2.2-4

thanks

Oh thought I already had replied, yeah that fixed it. 

**Edited <time datetime="2017-02-10T16:50:58Z" title="02/10/2017 04:50  PM" data-short="7 yr">February 10, 2017</time> by Crimor**

Sorry that I keep finding bugs, but it seems like with just kopernicus, modularflightmanager, GN, and GPP, it seems to think I'm always 0.0km away from the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">ksc</abbr> when recoverings stuff. Probably something that needs to be overridden in gpp's configs. Seems to be specifically because of Gael, with Gael staying even after removing gpp.
